    • Method Detail

      • create

        public boolean create​(java.lang.String name,
                      java.lang.String type,
                      java.lang.String password)
               throws AlreadyExistsException,
                      NullInputException,
                      InvalidDataException
        Creates a user and inserts the specified values into the database tables. Also hashes and inserts the password into the account table in the databse
        Parameters:
        name - The name for the user. Max 50 chars
        type - The type of user (proctor, team, administrator)
        password - The password for the user
        Returns:
        Boolean value representing successful insertion into the database
        Throws:
        AlreadyExistsException - There is already a user with the name
        NullInputException - One of the inputs are NULL, and cannot be
        InvalidDataException - One of the inputs are not correctly formatted
        See Also:
        AccountManager

      • update

        public boolean update​(int id,
                      java.lang.String name,
                      java.lang.String type)
               throws DoesNotExistException,
                      AlreadyExistsException,
                      InvalidDataException,
                      NullInputException
        This function allows the updating of a user, you must specify all values of user to update the user
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the team you are updating
        name - The name for the user. Max 50 chars
        type - The type of user (proctor, team, administrator)
        Returns:
        Boolean value representing sucessful updating of tuple
        Throws:
        DoesNotExistException - There is no user with that id
        AlreadyExistsException - There is already a user with the specified name
        InvalidDataException - Incorrectly formatted data was passed to the function
        NullInputException - One of the inputs to the function are NULL and shouldn't be
        See Also:
        getId(java.lang.String)

      • delete

        public boolean delete​(int id)
        Deletes a user based on it's id

        *Note: Anything that references this user will also be deleted as a result*

        Parameters:
        id - Id of the user to delete
        Returns:
        Boolean value representing successful deletion
        See Also:
        getId(java.lang.String)

        public boolean delete​(java.lang.String name)

        *Note: Anything that references this user will also be deleted as a result*

        Parameters:
        name - Name of the user to delete
        Returns:
        Boolean value representing successful deletion
        See Also:
        getId(java.lang.String)
